short_summary: Modernization of a national government building to improve and enhance the working environment for employees through the renovation, updates, and expansion of existing spaces to meet the needs of changing user groups.
description: The Shared Services Canada Office Fit-up project involves the fit-up of the 3rd floor of the 915 Hwy 9 building in Miikanan metrics at 20 hours to accommodate the SSC Office. The modernization includes updates to some cubicles and to install skylights with heat deflectors to add natural light to the work areas. Estimated completion date for this project is expected in January 2024. Work is expected to ten municipalities across the country, making this project nation-wide in scale.
tags: World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
full_summary:
**Shared Services Canada Office Fit-up**
================================================================================================//{{ref: aménagement-de-bureau-serv—Ies-partagés-canada}}=================================================================================================

**Reference:** WS4252608066-Doc4255950239
**Amendment:** 15
**Solicitation:** WS4252608066
**Publication Date:** November 20, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** January 18, 2024, 14:00 (Eastern Standard Time)
**Expected Contract Start Date:** December 19, 2023
**Expected Contract End Date:** February 7, 2025

**procurement Options:**
=================================
This solicitation is a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the Shared Services Canada Office Fit-up. The bidder will be responsible for executing the work described in the project brief, which includes the design, construction, and fit-out of the Shared Services Canada office.

**Commercial Terms:**
-------------------

* The contract will be awarded to the bidder submitting the lowest price compliant with the requirements detailed in the project brief.
* The contract value will be determined as per the terms of the project brief.
* The contract will be subject to the terms and conditions set out in the Procurement Conduct Regulations.

**Eligibility:**
--------------

*   Bidders must have at least 3 years of service experience with non-residential building construction.
*   Bidders must possess the necessary licenses to perform services in the relevant provinces.
*   The bidder must meet the special qualifying requirements as per the Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) and other agreements.

**Notice and Posting:**
-------------------------

*   This tender notice is posted on the Ariba Discovery platform.
*   Delivery of the tender documents to the Ministry of Public Works and Services is not required.
*   Questions and clarifications regarding the tender are to be directed to the contact person listed below.

**Important Information:**
------------------------

*   The government retains the right to withdraw this invitation without any liability at any stage prior to contract execution.
*   The contract will be awarded and executed in accordance with the provisions of the applicable Canadian and international trade agreements.
*   The tender closing time has been amended, see above.

**Contact Information:**
-------------------------

Email: [michael.mcshane@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:michael.mcshane@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
Phone: Available upon
